Created by Nik Tumbri (based on James McKay\'s SMS-via-MNF)
This is a program that uses the PennyTel ( http://www.pennytel.com.au/ ) PennyTel SMS API v2 to send SMSs through the user\'s PennyTel SMS service.
You need to be a PennyTel Customer in order to use this program. Find out more at https://www.pennytel.com.au/
Contact me via github if you have any questions, comments, complaints, suggestions, donations, etc.
PennyTel is a trademark of PennyTel Pty Ltd
Here is more info about each field
To - the destination number. One destination only. For all numbers, please use E.164 format. i.e. [country code][number] (614xxxxxxxx)
Message - the text message to send. Only the first 160 characters will be sent.
PennyTel VoIP Username - your PennyTel VoIP username, as displayed in the PennyTel Portal, e.g. 888xxxxxxx
PennyTel VoIP Password - your PennyTel VoIP password, as displayed in the PennyTel Portal
Registered Caller ID for the SMS - Caller ID for the SMS. Must be one of the registered and verified mobile number of the PennyTel Account in International Format (E.164).

Format phone numbers correctly - Formats the phone numbers to an acceptable form (i.e. turning "9999-9999" into "99999999", "04xxxxxxxx" into "614xxxxxxxx"). This works for some formats of phone numbers. You can always edit the number if it is wrong. A "0" at the start of a number will be replaced with "61" - this will cause you problems if you are not in Australia, sending to an Australian number. You can avoid this altogether by using the correct E.164 format
"Cancel" button - Discard changes and return to the main screen
"Save" button - Save changes and return to the main screen
